title: Claude Tool Definition: provide_valuation_suggestion
description: Tool definition for Claude API to provide structured valuation suggestions

description.const: Provide a structured valuation suggestion for a contribution to the Slicing Pie equity model. Call this tool when the user describes a contribution that can be valued. Include all required fields to ensure the suggestion can be applied to the contribution form.

type.description: The contribution type. Use 'time' for hours worked, 'cash' for money invested, 'non-cash' for equipment/supplies, 'idea' for intellectual property, 'relationship' for network/sales connections.

value.description: The numeric value. For 'time' contributions, this is hours worked. For all other types, this is the dollar amount.

dollarValue.description: Optional dollar equivalent for ideas and relationships. Use when the value field represents something other than dollars (e.g., a percentage or abstract score).

confidence.description: Your confidence level in this valuation. Use 'low' when making assumptions, 'medium' for reasonable estimates, 'high' when the user provided clear details.

reasoning.description: Brief explanation of how you arrived at this valuation. Include any assumptions made.

examples.name: provide_valuation_suggestion
examples.description: Provide a structured valuation suggestion for a contribution to the Slicing Pie equity model.

exampleInputs.userMessage: I worked about 45 hours on the MVP last month

expectedToolInput.reasoning: User explicitly stated 45 hours of work on the MVP.

exampleInputs.userMessage: I contributed my camera equipment worth around $2000

expectedToolInput.reasoning: User provided approximate value of $2000 for camera equipment contribution.

exampleInputs.userMessage: I brought in a client connection that could be worth a lot

expectedToolInput.reasoning: Estimated value based on typical client relationship. User did not provide specific numbers, so confidence is low.
